intro: Linum abyssinicum, commonly known as Abyssinian flax, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Linaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
